file_name: Zounds Hearing, Inc. - MANUFACTURING DESIGN MARKETING AGREEMENT.txt

perturbation.original_text: This MANUFACTURING, DESIGN AND MARKETING AGREEMENT (this "Agreement") is entered into by and between Zounds Hearing, Inc., a Delaware corporation ("Subcontractor") and InnerScope Hearing Technologies, Inc., a Nevada corporation, (the "Manufacturer") Manufacturer dated effective October 3, 2018 (the "Effective Date"). Subcontractor and Manufacturer may also be referred to herein individually as "Party" or collectively as the "Parties".
perturbation.changed_text: This MANUFACTURING, DESIGN AND MARKETING AGREEMENT (this "Agreement") is entered into by and between Zounds Hearing, Inc., a Delaware corporation ("Contractor") and InnerScope Hearing Technologies, Inc., a Nevada corporation, (the "Manufacturer") Manufacturer dated effective October 3, 2018 (the "Effective Date"). Contractor and Manufacturer may also be referred to herein individually as "Party" or collectively as the "Parties".
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Subcontractor' is changed to 'Contractor'. This creates a potential contradiction because the agreement refers to Zounds Hearing, Inc. as 'Subcontractor' and 'Contractor' interchangeably throughout the document without explicitly defining if both mean the same thing, which could lead to confusion regarding responsibilities and obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Since Manufacturer is paying the actual manufacturing cost of the product, Supplier has not reserved for any warranty related costs. The Manufacturer acknowledges that it is solely responsible for any warranty costs associated with Manufacturer's Products. Should any nonconformities be detected during or after the manufacturing process, Subcontractor will assist Manufacturer in resolving any quality issues with the suppliers.
perturbation.changed_text: Since Manufacturer is paying the actual manufacturing cost of the product, Vendor has not reserved for any warranty related costs. The Manufacturer acknowledges that it is solely responsible for any warranty costs associated with Manufacturer's Products. Should any nonconformities be detected during or after the manufacturing process, Subcontractor will assist Manufacturer in resolving any quality issues with the suppliers.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Supplier' is changed to 'Vendor'. This creates ambiguity. It's unclear if 'Vendor' refers to the same entity as 'Subcontractor,' or if a third party is being introduced. This uncertainty affects the interpretation of warranty responsibilities and the handling of nonconformities.

perturbation.original_text: Following inspections by applicable regulatory authorities, including, without limitation, the FDA, Subcontractor shall do such actions or cause such actions to be done that are necessary, advisable or appropriate so that Subcontractor remains in good standing with any such regulatory authorities.
perturbation.changed_text: Following inspections by applicable regulatory authorities, including, without limitation, the FDA, Subcontractor shall do such actions or cause such actions to be done that are necessary, advisable or appropriate so that Producer remains in good standing with any such regulatory authorities.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Subcontractor' to 'Producer' in this context creates significant ambiguity. The document never defines 'Producer,' thus introducing an entirely new, undefined party that is now seemingly responsible for maintaining regulatory compliance. This could create legal disputes over compliance obligations.
